i1.name: Umbra Blades
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} Periodically, '''Nocturne's''' next [[basic attack]] deals {{as|20% AD}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} to the target and {{as|120% AD}} {{as|physical damage}} to surrounding enemies, while also {{tip|healing}} himself for {{pp|15 to 40}} {{as|(+ 15% AP)}} per enemy hit.

''Umbra Blades''' damage to the primary target can {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}} for{{ft|{{as|{{critical damage|192.5|110}} AD}} {{as|physical damage}}.|110% of the {{sti|{{as|critical damage}}}} of his basic attacks.}}
Basic attacks reduce ''Umbra Blades' '' {{sti|cooldown}} by 1 second, increased to 3 seconds against {{tip|monsters}} and enemy {{tip|champions}}.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Periodically, Nocturne's next basic attack deals 20% AD bonus physical damage to the target and 120% AD physical damage to surrounding enemies, while also healing himself for 15undefined − 40undefined (based on level) (+ 15% AP) per enemy hit.
Umbra Blades' damage to the primary target can critically strike for
Basic attacks reduce Umbra Blades' cooldown by 1 second, increased to 3 seconds against monsters and enemy champions.
i1.notes:
* Basic attacks against structures will reduce ''Umbra Blades' ''cooldown but will not trigger the {{tip|splash damage}}.
* The enhanced attack will apply other [[on-hit effect]]s (only to main target) and can {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}} as normal.
* {{Pending for test}}: ''Umbral Blade's'' interaction with ''parrying'' effects ({{tip|dodge}}, {{tip|block}}, {{tip|blind}}).

q1.name: Duskbringer
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Nocturne''' sends out a shadow blade in a line in the target direction that leaves a ''Dusk Trail'' on its path, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to enemies it passes through and causing enemy {{tip|champion|champions}} hit to also leave a ''Dusk Trail'' behind their movement for 5 seconds.
While on the ''Dusk Trail'', '''Nocturne''' is {{tip|ghosted}} and gains {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} and {{as|{{sti|'''bonus''' attack damage}}}}.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Nocturne sends out a shadow blade in a line in the target direction that leaves a Dusk Trail on its path, dealing physical damage to enemies it passes through and causing enemy champions hit to also leave a Dusk Trail behind their movement for 5 seconds.
While on the Dusk Trail, Nocturne is ghosted and gains bonus movement speed and bonus attack damage.
q1.notes:
* ''Duskbringer's'' damage is not increased by the {{as|'''bonus''' AD}} gained from its trail, meaning that casting it again while on the trail from the last cast will not result in higher damage.
** It is observed from seasons ago that this is intentionally hard-coded into the ability to avoid the projectile increasing its own damage. This feature is somewhat deprecated as it also limits chain-casting ''Duskbringer''.
* ''Duskbringer's Dusk Trail'' will expose the path of affected units until its duration ends. It is a form of {{tip|obscured vision}}; the trail indirectly reveals the location of enemy units even in the fog of war, including those shrouded by {{tip|stealth}}.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} will block the damage and also prevents the ''Dusk Trail'' from following the target.
* The formed ''Dusk Trail'' does not disappear if ''Duskbringer'' is intercepted by {{ai|Wind Wall|Yasuo}} or {{ai|Unbreakable|Braum}}.
* ''Duskbringer'' will fire from wherever '''Nocturne''' was at the start of the cast time.
* The {{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}} {{tip|stacks multiplicatively}} with other sources of movement speed boosts.

• Movement Speed: %

w1.name: Shroud of Darkness
description: Blocking an ability doubles ''Shroud of Darkness' ''passive {{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}} for 5 seconds.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Nocturne gains bonus attack speed.
Active: Nocturne gains a spell shield for 1.5 seconds.
Blocking an ability doubles Shroud of Darkness' passive bonus attack speed for 5 seconds.
leveling: {{st|Bonus Attack Speed|{{ap|30 to 50}}%|Enhanced Bonus Attack Speed|{{ap|30*2 to 50*2}}%}}
w1.notes: * If ''Shroud of Darkness'' is active when '''Nocturne''' re-casts {{ai|Paranoia|Nocturne}} to dash to a target, it'll stay active until '''Nocturne''' reaches his target.

effects.str:
• Bonus Attack Speed: %
  • Enhanced Bonus Attack Speed: %

e1.name: Unspeakable Horror
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Nocturne''' gains {{sti|ms|{{as|90% '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} when moving toward {{tip|flee|fleeing}} targets.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Nocturne''' plants nightmares into the target enemy's mind, forming a {{tip|tether}} between '''Nocturne''' and the target for 2 seconds, during which the target takes {{as|magic damage}} over the duration.
If the tether is not broken by the end of its duration, the target is made to {{tip|Flee|flee}} from '''Nocturne''' for a duration, during which they are {{tip|slow|slowed}} by 90%.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Nocturne gains 90% bonus movement speed when moving toward fleeing targets.
Active: Nocturne plants nightmares into the target enemy's mind, forming a tether between Nocturne and the target for 2 seconds, during which the target takes magic damage over the duration.
If the tether is not broken by the end of its duration, the target is made to flee from Nocturne for a duration, during which they are slowed by 90%.
e1.notes: * {{tip|Spell shield}} will block the tether's application but not the damage and aftereffects of one already applied.

r1.name: Paranoia
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Nocturne''' inflicts unstable terror upon all enemy champions, {{tip|nearsight|nearsighting}} them for 6 seconds. ''Paranoia'' can be recast for the same duration after {{fd|0.25}} seconds.
{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Nocturne''' {{tip|dash|dashes}} with {{tip|displacement immunity}} to the target enemy {{tip|champion}}, dealing them {{as|physical damage}} upon arrival.
If {{ai|Shroud of Darkness|Nocturne}} is active at the time of ''Paranoia's'' recast, its duration is refreshed every {{fd|0.25}} seconds for the flight.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Nocturne inflicts unstable terror upon all enemy champions, nearsighting them for 6 seconds. Paranoia can be recast for the same duration after 0.25 seconds.
Recast: Nocturne dashes with displacement immunity to the target enemy champion, dealing them physical damage upon arrival.
If Shroud of Darkness is active at the time of Paranoia's recast, its duration is refreshed every 0.25 seconds for the flight.
r1.notes:
* '''Nocturne''' will track the target if they change locations.
** He will dash to the target's previous location without dealing damage if the target is too far away or moves beyond the maximum tracking distance.
* ''Paranoia's'' {{tip|nearsight}} will apply to enemy champions that are {{tip|untargetable}} or are dead, and will persist through {{tip|death}}.
* '''Nocturne''' can cast any of his [[champion ability|abilities]], [[summoner spell|summoner spells]] (excluding {{si|Hexflash}}), or [[active ability items|item actives]] during flight.
** Using a {{tip|dash}} or {{tip|blink}} ability will interrupt the flight.
* ''Paranoia'' cannot be recast while {{tip|ground|grounded}} or {{tip|root|rooted}}.
* ''Paranoia's'' {{tip|nearsight}} does not apply to {{tip|clone|clones}}.
* [[summoner|Players']] screens will turn a different color when ''Paranoia'' is cast, based on their perspective: blue for allies and red for enemies.
* A [[spell indicator]] telegraphed to '''Nocturne''' and his allies will be placed on all enemy {{tip|champion|champions}} within range of ''Paranoia's'' recast while the ability is active. ''The following images display the indicator for the default [[skin]]:''
[[File:Nocturne_Original_Paranoia_Indicator_Red.png|thumb|left|A glowing '''{{color|#8b0000|red silhouette}}''' of '''Nocturne's''' blades indicates an enemy champion can be targeted by ''Paranoia's'' recast.]]
[[File:Nocturne Original Paranoia Indicator.png|thumb|left|A glowing '''{{color|#32CD32|green silhouette}}''' of '''Nocturne's''' blades signifies an enemy champion has been targeted by ''Paranoia's'' recast.]]
r1.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '{{tt|{{ap|140|115|90}}|Starts post-effect}}' as '0/140/115/90/0' and riot's value '140,115,90' as '140/115/90'
